result.execSummary:
All charges against Sidney Brown in this case have been dismissed. These charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Sidney Brown is presumed innocent.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Defendant Sidney Brown in court with attorney Michael L. Chernin.  Defendant Sidney Brown in custody.  Zachary A Wittchow appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
  Deputy Court Clerk: tmk.
 Case set for jury trial. Court made a record and marked exhibit 1, 2, and 3. To remain in court file as part of the record. On the State's Motion, Court orders case dismissed without prejudice.

Attorney Michael L. Chernin in court, defendant Sidney Brown not in court, in custody.  Zachary A Wittchow appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk: tmk.
Held off the record. Case set for final pretrial. Case remains in jury trial posture. Court grants State's request to adjourn Jury Trial by one day. Due to court congestion and the time of day, final pretrial will be be held on the morning of jury trial. Court will accept negotiations on the morning of trial. Jury trial on 08-22-2016 rescheduled to 08-23-2016 at 9:00 am, branch 17. FILE RETAINED IN COURT.  Jury trial scheduled for August 23, 2016 at 09:00 am.
State's Motion to Adjourn Trial by One Day, received and filed. tk

Amended Information, received and filed. tk

Deputy Court Clerk: nm

Held off the record. Case set for final pre-trial.  State request an adjournment, State is in trial in Branch 35.  Case adjourned for Final Pre-Trial on 08-12-2016 at 8:30 am, branch 17.  Final pre-trial scheduled for August 12, 2016 at 08:30 am.
JURY PANEL ORDERED. TK

Attorney Michael L. Chernin in court, defendant Sidney Brown not in court, in custody.  Defense waived defendants appearance for today's proceedings. Paul Michael Hauer appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk: tmk.
Case set for projected plea and sentencing hearing. Case set for Final Pretrial and Jury Trial. State's moves for joinder as to 16CF1156 and 15CF1617. Court granted to join cases for trial. Felony Pretrial Scheduling Order, signed and filed. Copies mailed to state and defense counsel. 

Parties to provide reports/summary of expert witness no later than 06-13-2016 by 5:00 pm. Any motions challenging the admissibility of proposed expert testimony due no later than 06-27-2016 by 5:00 pm. 

Case is adjourned for Final Pretrial Conference on 08-02-2016 at 8:30, and Jury Trial scheduled on 08-22-2016 at 9:00 am, Branch 17.  Final pre-trial scheduled for August 2, 2016 at 08:30 am.  Jury trial scheduled for August 22, 2016 at 09:00 am.

Attorney Michael L. Chernin in court, defendant Sidney Brown not in court, in custody.  Zachary A Wittchow appeared for the State of Wisconsin. 
 Deputy Court Clerk: tmk.
Held off the record, Case set for projected plea and sentencing hearing. Court in jury trial on another matter. Defense request an adjournment. Case adjourned for projected plea and sentencing hearing on 05-24-2016 at 8:30 am, branch 17.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for May 24, 2016 at 08:30 am.
All previously stated terms and conditions remain same.

BRANCH 22 FOR BRANCH 17

Attorney Michael L. Chernin in court, defendant Sidney Brown not in court, in custody.  Nicholas Steven Cerwin appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Return on bench warrant held. Bail hearing proceeded. Arguments by counsel. Court set cash bail of $1,000.00. All previously stated terms and conditions remain same. Case remains calendared in Branch 22.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for April 8, 2016 at 08:30 am.
Branch 17 in jury trial on another matter, Case spun to branch 22 for return on warrant.
Bench warrant cleared by the Milwaukee County Sheriff and in original warrant received.  Parties notified.  Case is scheduled for return on the bench warrant, Branch 17 on 03-07-2016 at 8:30 am.
Notice of bond forfeiture mailed to defendant; Original in file. ($10,000.00 signature bond) gj
COURT ORDERED DEFENDANT REMANDED TO THE JUDGE ON RETURN OF THE BENCH WARRANT.
Signature bond ordered to be forfeited in the amount of 10000.00.

Attorney Michael L. Chernin in court.  Zachary A Wittchow appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk: tmk.
  Defendant failing to appear, Court ordered a lifted Stayed Bench Warrant to be issued.  State's motion for Judgment of Bond Forfeiture 30 days after notification from the Clerk of Circuit Court's Office is granted by the Court.

Attorney Michael L. Chernin in court.  
Zachary A Wittchow appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk: dds.

Matter before the Court for Plea/sentencing.  Defendant NOT present.  Defense motion for stayed warrant heard and granted by the Court.  State has no objection at this time.  
The Court orders Bench Warrant to Issue with Remand to Judge.  The Court orders warrant STAYED until next court date.  The Court withholds decision as to forfeiture of any bail/bond.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for November 25, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Sidney Brown in court with attorney Michael L. Chernin.  Zachary A Wittchow appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: KAR.
Case calendared for scheduling conference.
Defense counsel received discovery.  Any motions due no later than 11/20/15 at 8:30 am. Court orders case for adjourned projected plea and sentencing on 11/20/15 at 8:30 am, Branch 17.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for November 20, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Case adjourned for Scheduling Conference on 10/14/2015 at 8:30 am in branch 17.
Received and Filed, Paperwork on behalf of defendant provided by defense counsel.

Court ordered no possession or use of controlled substances without a valid prescription or any dangerous weapons or firearms.   
Court advised defendant that failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.
DEFENDANT WAS ORDERED BY THE COURT TO REPORT TO THE MILWAUKEE COUNTY JAIL (CJF) TO BE BOOKED AND RELEASED BY 3:00 P.M. ON  (10/13/2015). IF THEY FAIL TO APPEAR A BENCH WARRANT WILL BE ISSUED FOR THEIR ARREST.
Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant pled not guilty.
Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed.  Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.

Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Konkol, Branch 44.  Request for Substitution of Judge received and filed.  Court consented to substitution against Judge Konkol.  Parties are advised the Clerk of Circuit Court reassigned case pursuant to current court rules to Judge Stark, Br. 17.
Defendant given a copy of complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT DOES NOT QUALIFY FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.
